definitions.text: an electrical device that provides a path for electrical current to flow
a journey or route all the way around a particular place or area
examples: they took an extended tour of Europe
we took a quick circuit of the park
a ten-day coach circuit of the island

definitions.text: an established itinerary of venues or events that a particular group of people travel to
examples: she's a familiar name on the club circuit
the judge makes a circuit of the courts in his district

definitions.text: the boundary line encompassing an area or object
examples: he had walked the full circumference of his land
a danger to all races over the whole circumference of the globe

definitions.text: (law) a judicial division of a state or the United States (so-called because originally judges traveled and held court in different locations); one of the twelve groups of states in the United States that is covered by a particular circuit court of appeals

examples: he drove an extra lap just for insurance
They were circuiting about the state
